website_summaries.verdict: Made using smart foam technology that actually forms to your body.
pros: We love how this protector adheres to your unique shape and as well as your jacket
Easy to put on and take off, and great for everyday use
Customers rave about the naturalness of the fit
cons: Would be even better if the ventilation was more consistent throughout this protective piece

customer_reviews.title: It brakes itself
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to upgrade my standard back protector for a Joe Rocket Jacket. I ordered 1 year ago and it broke itself (I haven't had an accident or take off this product of the jacket until now. I don't use a lot this jacket but this is the result of light use. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: If you want to great back protection, get this.
customer_reviews.text: Don't kid yourself, you cannot go cheap on your back and spine. If you want to great back protection, get this. It's CE Level 2 rated and is quite heavy and durable, yet pliable at the same time. It fits in my Joe Rocket jacket perfectly and is bright orange, which can actually be seen through my mesh jacket, so that's just an added bonus. It adds several pounds to my jacket, but again that's nothing compared to the safety benefit this product can provide.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: So-so construction, and HOT!!
customer_reviews.text: Most of the air vents in my unit were plugged by molding flash. I had to spend about a half-hour snipping little pieces of D30 out of the way. Even then, this thing is REALLY WARM. Anywhere it touches me, it's like a heating blanket. I had a big sweaty band across my shoulder blades where its natural resting point just toasted my back. And this is under a mesh jacket with lots of air flow. I would recommend it only for cold rides.
customer_reviews.author: G3

customer_reviews.title: Much better protection than most stock pads
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace the OE back pad in my jacket. Only problem I had was trying to fit it in because the slit to fit it through was ridiculously narrow. I just warmed it up (do not heat in microwave or oven!) by holding over my kerosene heater until it was real flexible, folded the "wings", and slid it home. Felt a little weird the first few times riding with it but it is so much more substantial than what came with the jacket...
customer_reviews.author: Doc Samson

customer_reviews.title: Added protection for compromise jackets
customer_reviews.text: I put it in the back of my Joe Rocket Phoenix Ion mesh jacket(what I commute with) to replace the factory soft armor. I wanted something with more protection. It's comfortable, and if you 'whack' it hard you can barely feel the shock. I hope I never really have to test it, and the Phoenix Ion is my compromise jacket... I use it for commuting when it's REALLY hot. This hopefully gives me enough extra protection to make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: ObiJohnKenobe

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Best (and most affordable) upgrade I could have made to the Street & Steel scrambler jacket. Replaced that rigid, cardboard-like chunk of foam that made me feel like Frankenstein's monster with this, and suddenly the jacket fits close to form and feels so much more natural. Not to mention upgraded protection. I checked the product and unlike another reviewer, did get the Level 2 rated protector as expected so no issues there. Best upgrade for your jacket imo.
customer_reviews.author: motodoc817

customer_reviews.title: Feels denser than squishy foam in Scorpion EXO
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are comparing it with the foam from Scorpion EXO jacket. - CE level 2 - Fit in Scorpion EXO jacket - It feels denser, than foam that came with the jacket. - Easily fit in the jacket. - Yes some of the holes aren’t punched all the way through, just take a knife to it.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, hope to never find out how well it works
customer_reviews.text: Fit right inside my jacket as expected, seems like the size/shape of these things is very standard. Nice airflow through it in my mesh jacket, flexible and comfortable even on longer rides. Definitely worth the money to step up from the cheap foam back pad most jackets seem to come with. J.Ja
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. James

customer_reviews.title: Would have got five stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the product fits my joe rocket jacket perfectly but like everyone else review the finishing did not quite make it an all star. Vent holes were still filled in. I had to use drill to remove the excess material and I almost damaged the pad. luckily its just surface. Please have QC product to ensure that the vent holes are completely open
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo R. Santos

customer_reviews.title: D3O is scary cool armor. Replaced the nonsense trash armor in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Klim. What else needs to be said ? D3O is scary cool armor. Replaced the nonsense trash armor in my Seddici Adv Gear Jacket. Works like a champ. Just wish there was a D30 chest plate. Fit in the jacket ok. most adult sized motorcycle jackets have a standard range of size for the armor pockets. Your mileage will vary based on the quality of you jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Me the CISSP

customer_reviews.title: Great price for some of the best armor you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: A great upgrade to my jacket. Exceptionally good armor I hope I never have to use. It's a lot thicker than I thought it was going to be, not complaining.. I've never cried myself to sleep over spending money on quality. So if you're going to do it especially for yourself do it right! As Klim says "why ? because sometimes we just got to learn the hard way".
customer_reviews.author: ksol

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for Joe Rocket pretend back armor.
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be a good replacement for the crappy OEM back armor that came with my Joe Rocket jacket. Poor QC on this item caused me to open up the vent holes with a router as pictured. Fits well in the jacket. Description did not specify, but this item shows as a CE Level 2 rated product.
customer_reviews.author: WheelchairMD

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, safe, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, but safer than standard foam pads - and it doesn't shove your helmet forward if you have a back rest! Bought this one for my wife. I've had one for two years and really like it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the crappy foam back pad that does nothing with this great armor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value, Wear your Gear!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing material. Fit perfectly in the slot made for it on my Scorpion EXO. The only gripe, as mentioned by others, some of the ventilation holes were blocked by material not properly punched out. Easy fix with a sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: IronAltar

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic!! I had a place sewed into my jacket to fit this as it had no place for back protection. The D30 is amazing stuff!! Great seller ,great price AAAAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: mtn tracker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Comfortable, flexible, works as advertised. Great purchase vs original armor
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for foam pads that typically come with jackets. This adds a certain degree of confidence and assurance when riding. I will be purchasing more to replace pads in my other jackets. Well worth the price...
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestilskin

customer_reviews.title: Good and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Well i hope i never need to test it but it feels like is should hold up. Like any other armor ive tried. It still gets hot and sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for retrofit armor
customer_reviews.text: Recently retrofitted one of my tourmaster outfits for sport-touring. The stuff is CE level 2 armor, soft and pliable and provides excellent protection.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Soft until you need it
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Soft until you need it, hardens instantly when you get an impact. Replaced a foam back pad in my winter riding jacket.
customer_reviews.author: rondawg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, I just wish it had better ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, I just wish it had better ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCheese

customer_reviews.title: Good armor that fit fine, but in an Icon package, not Klim
customer_reviews.text: Fit fine in my Klim Latitude jacket to replace the cracked in half Level 1 D30 armour. Was actually in an Icon branded package, not Klim.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Must have with bike gear
customer_reviews.text: Right choice for matching high end bike gear must use in all your gear. Its safe and very lightweight and you dont feel its there because it stick to body contour
customer_reviews.author: Trendsetter

customer_reviews.title: D30 back protector
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. New lighter and softer back protector. I saw videos about this product where the person doing the demo actually wrapped his hands with the D30 product and hit hand with a hammer. I did a similar test and it work. For the product review purposes this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Fits in my Joe rocket Phoenix 5.0. Great quality, hopefully never have to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This item is as described, but the reason for ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is as described, but the reason for the -1 star is because the ventilation holes in the pad weren't cleared out, so I had to do it manually.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: Great protection.
customer_reviews.text: Klim is top notch protection you can get. Worth the price. Replaced all my jackets with this protector. Heavy duty, better than the foam crap that comes stock in most jackets.
customer_reviews.author: ARTHUR

customer_reviews.title: First FG Kathmandu
customer_reviews.text: This Klim fits the Firstgear Kathmandu perfectly. Don't hesitate to buy if you want to upgrade the armor in that jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed
customer_reviews.text: Great back pad. Safer then the icon foam. Flexible and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Butters

customer_reviews.title: Check the item you receive!!
customer_reviews.text: After a thorough inspection of the back pad itself, the one I received was CE Level 1 Viper... not Level 2, though the package had the correct label on it. I have sent mine back for return and hope this was an isolated incident. The price is top dollar for the CE level 2, so make sure you are getting what you ordered (check the imprinted label on the bottom of the actual back pad! It should say EN-1621-2 Level 2, not EN-1621-2 Level 1). 2 stars for fast shipping though... and least that was on point.
customer_reviews.author: Baxtro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It actually improved airflow over my tour master back padding
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Great product only gave it 4 stars because you have to go through and poke all the breather holes other than that it’s great
customer_reviews.author: david fernandez

customer_reviews.title: smooth
customer_reviews.text: A little bit expansive but perfect to save your back still in good state after 1 year of use almost everyday. No problem at all. just a little bit heavy
customer_reviews.author: ConSommateur

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Doing well so far, it's not too thick and fits in my Firstgear Kilimanjaro jacket nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great back protector, was a great replacement for my jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Mal4

customer_reviews.title: I love the quality and the protection is appears to provide ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for my 2 piece race leathers and one for my casual riding jacket. Unfortunately for whatever reason, the one in my leathers broke in half in just a few months of use. I love the quality and the protection is appears to provide but it didn't even make it through one season of riding. I'm not sure I will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L

customer_reviews.title: Great material for protection.
customer_reviews.text: Great protection to slip in behind you in your jacket. Hope to never test it for real, but it is comfortable and breathes nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great back replacement compared to the factory back protectors
customer_reviews.text: Havent been in an accident to fully review this product but based on the fact that it is CE2 and D30 armor. It beats better than the standard flimsy item that comes with most motorcycle jacket. Just like the song from Slim Shady "your spinal fluid is final and you wont get it back" should you get into a sever accident with your back Only drawback is that this may be too big to fit into some back protector. I wear a size L motorcycle jacket and had small fitment issues
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use in both my street and offroad jackets - comfortable and appears effective!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Giachino

customer_reviews.title: I went with this because it was thicker and offered ...
customer_reviews.text: I went with this because it was thicker and offered more protection. It does add weight. I am ok with it, just something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny A

customer_reviews.title: fits great and wont move
customer_reviews.text: This is the one that will fit and not move around in the pocket. take a bit to get it in the back of the jacket and ride around a bit until it settles but then you are golden. amazed at how light it is but yet how much protection it provides. went for a uber long day ride in the rocky cascades and laid on my back in the shade in the middle of a rock garden during lunch. felt great. super stoked.
customer_reviews.author: Warfighter OutfittersTop Contributor: Metal Detecting

product_meta.title: Klim 5174-001-000-400 D3O Replacement Back Pad Level 2 Viper
product_meta.description:
Klim D3O Replacement Back Pad Level 2 Viper 
High quality performance shock absorption
Trusted protection
Maximum flexibility
Extremely comfortable
Tested to highest standards

specifications.Model: D3o Replacement Back Pad Level 2 Viper
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars81 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
